page.title: 01OVERVIEW, NORTH WEST DERBY
page.content: This block covers the NW section of one of the newest cities in England. It is an area of marked contrasts containing most of the important features concerned with administration and commerce found in the city. To the North and West are Darley & Markeaton Parks: large areas of open space for recreation & leisure. All types of housing are represented in the residential areas. In the centre, Derby's blend of old and new buildings are exemplified by the Cathedral & the Assembly Rooms. Modern city developments alongside conservation schemes have retained the character of earlier ages, for example the Georgian mansions in Friargate, whilst providing for the needs of a thriving industrial city.
